intro: Galium catalinense subsp. catalinense, commonly known as Catalina bedstraw, is a flowering plant native to the western United States, particularly found on the island of Catalina. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family and is characterized by its slender, ascending stems and small, opposite leaves. The plant produces clusters of tiny white or pale yellow flowers, which are typically borne in the axils of the leaves. It thrives in sandy or rocky soils and is often found in coastal or inland scrub habitats. Due to its limited distribution, it is considered a rare and endangered species.
